intro: Psychotria nouhuyzii, commonly known as the Ecuadorian psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the humid lowland forests of Ecuador and is characterized by its strikingly colored flowers, often with bright red or orange petals. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and arranged oppositely along the stems. Psychotria nouhuyzii is notable for its ecological role in supporting local insect and bird populations.
